title: Quiz 12: Dissemination & Utilization
description: Communicating findings and applying research in practice.

questions.question: What is a 'query letter'?

options.text: A letter determining an editor's interest in a manuscript

questions.explanation: Query letters determine if an editor is interested in a manuscript.
questions.hint: Think about contacting a journal before submitting.

questions.question: What are barriers to research utilization? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Lack of knowledge, negative attitudes, and lack of support are barriers. Excessive dissemination is not.
questions.hint: Think about what prevents using research.

questions.question: Presenting at conferences allows for more rapid dissemination of findings than journal publication.
questions.explanation: Conference presentations are faster than journal publication.
questions.hint: Think about the timeline of publishing vs presenting.

questions.question: Match the nurse role to the activity.
questions.explanation: PI leads, Evaluator critiques, User applies, Subject provides data.
questions.hint: Think about different ways nurses engage with research.

questions.question: A ___BLANK___ journal uses subject experts to evaluate manuscripts before publication.
questions.explanation: Refereed journals use peer review by subject experts.

questions.question: What is the typical publication lag for journals?
questions.explanation: Journal publication lag ranges from 1 month to 3 years.
questions.hint: Think about how long peer review takes.

questions.question: What are 'Galley Proofs'?
questions.explanation: Galley Proofs are typeset sheets showing how the article will appear.
questions.hint: Think about the final layout before publication.

questions.question: It is ethical to conceal research findings if they contradict the sponsor's wishes.
questions.explanation: Concealing findings is unethical regardless of sponsor wishes.
questions.hint: Research integrity requires reporting all findings.

questions.question: Which of the following are methods of dissemination? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Keeping raw data in a drawer

questions.explanation: Journals, conferences, and reports are dissemination methods. Keeping data hidden is not.
questions.hint: Think about ways to share findings.

questions.question: Order the steps of publishing.
questions.explanation: Steps: Select journal → Query letter → Submit → Peer review → Publication.
questions.hint: Start with choosing where to publish.
